intro: Silene olympica var. olympica, commonly known as the Olympic campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. Silene olympica var. olympica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its beauty.
